info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Churchill and south east Pershing Counties through 900 PM PDT... At 758 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles northeast of Stillwater to 36 miles southeast of Trinity Junction to 18 miles west of New Pass Summit to 17 miles east of Middlegate. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, small hail, and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Roadways may become flooded and small streams may overflow their banks. Locations impacted include... Healy Peak, Dixie Valley, Silver Hill, Caroll Summit, Cain Mountain, Hyder Hot Springs, Mount Augusta and Lone Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
